page.title: 19TALKING TO OLDER PEOPLE
page.content: This village has changed so much over the past ten years. It is interesting to listen to people like Mrs. Chidlow, who was the school caretaker until last year. She remembers the{horse-race meeting, which was held every year, when the school was closed for a holiday; and when the only water for the school was a{pump}in the playground. Mr. Simister, Mr. Baker, Mrs. Chidlow and others have told us how strict school was. They told us how people used to go to the Village Hall for {filmshows,}and when a day out for the school was going on a cart to someone's field to have games and a tea. A special day was the Cricket Club Knock-out Competition. The children who went to the grammar school at Stoke or Market Drayton went by train from Pipe Gate.
